title: Temporary game mode idea: Traitor mode!
body:
Two teams of five play a regular match on SR. However, one player on each team is randomly appointed as the "traitor" before champion select starts. This player gets a loss if his team wins and a win if his team loses, and therefore has an incentive to toss the game. No one else on either team knows who the traitors are. (Edit: the enemy team knows who your traitor is and vice versa)

This player is not allowed to blatantly troll though: A team can start a vote against a player of their choice on their team at any time in game, declaring the target player the traitor. If they guess correctly, the team immediately wins and the traitor loses. If they guess wrong, the team loses and the traitor wins.

Nemesis draft was added as an answer to the misconception that low tier champs are "useless". Seeing as the community complains a lot about people who "intentionally play bad", perhaps we need this to demonstrate how difficult it is to actually do that.

?

replies.body:
The idea is cute, but "Guessing the traitor wins the game" seems to make the rest of the game completely arbitrary. Why push when you can just play a guessing game?

I'd say if you want to do something like this, look up "Shadows over Camelot" for an idea of how a Traitor would work, especially the process of outing them. In that game, one of the Knight of the Round Table is a traitor, and outing him limits his power but still allows him to participate in the game. However, accusing an loyal Knight costs you a point you need towards victory, and can only be done a certain amount of time into the game.

I'd say outing a Traitor should initially make them targetable by your team as if they were an enemy champion, though you still retain all of their vision while they lose yours. Once you kill them, the enemy respawns on the enemy team, but your team gets some massive buff to compensate, like a perpetual Baron buff, and you also get *the enemy's traitor,* who likewise gets the buff. But if you guess wrong, you end up killing a teammate, which grants global gold to the enemy team, and then can't accuse another traitor for...5 minutes or so.

Seems like a good idea.

Every 5 minutes each team can vote a traitor.  It allows them to kill them.  If it's the real traitor, that team gets a permanent baron buff for the rest of the game, and swaps the two traitors in the game teams.

This way the game isn't instantly decided by who figured out the traitor, it's possible the traitor did enough damage already (maybe they baited some really bad team fights putting their team far behind) but gives the other team an advantage for being correct.

I feel like voting for traitors, you should only have a limited amount of tries, because if you go once per 5 minutes, you'd find the traitor at 30 minutes. I think you should only get 3 tries to find the traitor limited by a 5 minute interval. There should also be something to help people guess who the traitor is, but I have no ideas for that.
Also, after 3 tries, you shouldn't automatically lose the game, you should just be stuck with the dilemma of entrusting anything to the 2 players who haven't been voted traitor, and knowing that at any time, they can throw the game.
Oh, and if players blatantly put out that they are the traitor (trolling, saying it in chat, etc) the vote system should switch that player to the other team, (so basically you switch the old traitors), and then a new traitor is chosen. There's a catch though, while you think that the old traitor on the enemy side would be your new traitor, it's actually not. The traitor choosing is randomized, and only limited by the fact that your new person cannot ever be a traitor in that round. So if the next traitor calls out that he or she is a traitor, then the same process happens but the person that had gotten recently switched, can now be a traitor.
Btw, this sounds like a fun game.

There is no dilemma. You HAVE to lose the game if you get it wrong. Otherwise it would be too tempting to just try a random vote and hope you get lucky (your suggestion of 3 tries would actually give you a 60% chance to win if you randomly vote). AND because you have to win if you get it right, in order to prevent the traitor from going afk or intentionally feeding in a very obvious manner.

Most games would not be decided by votes. The vote system is only there to ensure the traitor is sufficiently subtle about it (possible improvement: show to the enemy team who the traitor is, so they can help the traitor make it not so obvious. Editing OP). If the traitor is subtle enough, then his team won't dare to vote.

Hmm... What about this:

Each team has 1 randomly decided traitor. That traitor's victory condition is that the opposing team wins. (Stays the same)
*Global gold will affect the 4 members of your team and the 1 traitor on the enemy team*
*Global buffs will affect all 5 members of your team including the traitor to avoid unintentionally outing someone*

At the shop, the traitor can buy certain benefits for the enemy team. Here are some examples:
Ward Coordinates: Grants the enemy team vision of your currently placed wards. This vision lasts until those wards are gone. This does not reveal wards placed after the item is purchased.
Gold Stash: Steals up to 100 Gold from each member of your team and gives it to the enemy team. The gold will be taken from all other teammates and only affect loyal members of the enemy team. If a player has less than 100 gold, it will take all the gold they have.
Explosives: The enemy team deals additional magic damage to structures for 3 minutes.

Only 1 Traitor Item can be purchased every 5 minutes.
For the enemy team, you would get an announcement like: "An enemy informant has granted you vision!"

Much like the surrender vote, you can vote to declare someone is a traitor. This vote can be made 10 minutes into the game and every 5 minutes after that. The vote must be 3 out of the 4 not being voted on. That player loses vision of allied champions and can be targeted by them. It also disable's the traitor items in the shop for that player if the guess is correct.

Killing the Traitor grants global gold to your team and a temporary global buff. A killed traitor will then officially switch sides and respawn on the opposing team.

Falsely accusing an ally champion and slaying them grants the same global gold the the enemy team and the the global buff.

This buff and gold should be large enough to warrant not wanting to guess wrong.

The enemy team would also receive announcements on traitor votes, for example: "The enemy team has declared a traitor!"
A successful guess will also prompt this message in the chat box after the champion has been slain:  (Champion) has joined your team/the enemy team!

Replace X with either what destroyed the tower(minion, champion, etc) or with which tower was destroyed(it will be location specific)
